features.name: Nature Sense
features.desc: A druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Lore_Nature}Lore (nature){/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}.

features.name: Druid Proficiencies
features.desc:
Druids are proficient with the following weapons: club, dagger, dart, quarterstaff, scimitar, scythe, sickle, shortspear, sling, and spear. They are also proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} (claw, bite, and so forth) of any form they assume with wild shape.
Druids are proficient with light and medium armor but are prohibited from wearing metal armor; thus, they may wear only padded, leather, or hide armor. A druid may also wear wooden armor that has been altered by the ironwood {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} so that it functions as though it were steel. Druids are proficient with shields (except tower shields) but must use only wooden ones.

features.name: Nature Bond
features.desc:
At 1st level, a druid forms a bond with nature. This bond can take one of two forms. The first is a close tie to the natural world, granting the druid one of the following cleric domains: Air, Animal, Earth, Fire, Plant, Water, or Weather. When determining the powers and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} granted by this domain, the druid's effective cleric level is equal to her druid level. A druid that selects this option also receives additional domain spell slots, just like a cleric. She must prepare the spell from her domain in this slot and this spell cannot be used to cast a spell spontaneously.
The second option is to form a close bond with an animal companion. Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Alignment Restriction
features.desc: A druid who changes to a prohibited {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} loses all {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} and druid abilities (including her animal companion, but not including weapon, armor, and shield proficiencies). She cannot thereafter gain levels as a druid until she returns to a permitted alignment.

features.name: Spontaneous Summoning
features.desc: A druid can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time. She can "lose" a prepared spell in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower.

features.name: Woodland Stride
features.desc: At 3rd level, you can move through any sort difficult terrain at your normal {g|Encyclopedia:Speed}speed{/g} and without taking {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} or suffering any other impairment.

features.name: Resist Nature's Lure
features.desc: Starting at 4th level, a druid gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey and plants.

features.name: Wild Shape (Wolf)
features.desc:
At 4th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a wolf and back again once per day. The effect lasts for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.
Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.name: Wild Shape (Leopard)
features.desc:
At 4th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a wolf and back again once per day. The effect lasts for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.
Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.name: Wild Shape (Bear)
features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.name: Wild Shape (Medium Elemental)
features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.name: Venom Immunity
features.desc: At 9th level, a druid gains immunity to all poisons.

features.name: Wild Shape (Smilodon)
features.desc:
At 4th level, a druid gains the ability to turn herself into a wolf and back again once per day. The effect lasts for 1 hour per druid level, or until she changes back.
Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.

features.desc:

Changing form is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} and doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g}. A druid can use this ability an additional time per day at 6th level and every two levels thereafter, for a total of eight times at 18th level.
At 6th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a leopard or a small elemental. At 8th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a bear or a medium elemental. At 10th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a smilodon, a shambling mound, or a large elemental. At 12th level, a druid can use wild shape to change into a huge elemental.
For the feyspeaker archetype, all level prerequisites are increased by 2.

features.name: Blight Bond
features.desc: A blight druid may not bond with an animal companion, but may select from the {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}Death{/g} and Destruction domains in addition to those normally available.

features.name: Miasma
features.desc: Starting at 5th level, if a blight druid is adjacent to a creature at the beginning of its turn, the creature must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become sickened for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. A creature of the animal, fey, or plant type that fails its save is nauseated for 1 round and sickened for 1 minute thereafter. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours, as are creatures immune to disease.

features.name: Blightblooded
features.desc: At 9th level, a blight druid gains immunity to all diseases, including natural and supernatural diseases. She also becomes immune to effects that would cause her to become sickened or nauseated.

features.name: Plaguebearer
features.desc: Starting at 13th level, any creature that strikes a blight druid with a {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:UnarmedAttack}unarmed{/g} strike, or {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of 10 + 1/2 the druid's level + the druid's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier or become nauseated for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} and contract bubonic plague, as the contagion {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. If the creature makes its save, it is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

features.name: Enemy of the Fey
features.desc:
A defender of the true world gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on weapon {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey.
A defender of the true world can channel stored {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} energy into summoning spells that she hasn't prepared ahead of time, but she cannot use summon nature's ally to summon fey creatures. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 7th or lower level in order to cast any summon nature's ally spell of the same level or lower. She can "lose" a prepared spell of 8th level to cast summon elder earth elemental or "lose" a prepared spell of 9th level to cast summon elder worm.

features.name: Fey Stalker
features.desc: At 3rd level, the defender of the true world's animal companion and any creatures she summons with summon nature's ally gain a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} against fey creatures. This bonus increases to +2 at 8th level, +3 at 13th level, and +4 at 18th level.

features.name: Feybane
features.desc: Starting at 4th level, a defender of the true world gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}-like and {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}supernatural abilities{/g} of fey. She treats her {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} as cold iron for the purpose of overcoming {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}, and she gains a +2 bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to overcome the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} of fey creatures.

features.name: Beguiling Immunity
features.desc: At 9th level, a defender of the true world becomes immune to the mind-affecting effects of fey.

features.name: Fey Magic
features.desc:
At 1st level, a feyspeaker allows the strange idylls of the fey to guide her magic. The feyspeaker uses her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} score instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} score as her key {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spellcasting{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability score{/g} (to determine her spell DCs, bonus spells per day, {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g}, and so on).
At 4th, 6th, 8th, 10th, 12th, 14th, 16th, and 18th levels, a feyspeaker adds one Enchantment or Illusion spell from the sorcerer/wizard spell list to her druid spell list as a spell of 1 level higher (for instance, at 4th level, she could add color spray as a 2nd-level druid spell). In order to select a spell, she must be of a level high enough (including the increased spell level) to cast it. Once selected, the spell cannot be changed.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc:
At 4th level, a drovier can imbue her allies (including herself ) with an aspect of a wild animal. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, she chooses an animal totem and grants the abilities of that totem to every ally within 30 feet. This otherwise functions like the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} animal aspect. She can use this ability for 10 minutes per druid level each day. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be used in 10-minute increments. If she uses the ability to grant a new aspect, any previous aspect immediately ends.
At 6th level, the drovier's communal aspect ability grants the benefits of the spell greater animal aspect.
At 8th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the falcon instead of an animal aspect.
At 10th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the bear instead of an animal aspect.
At 12th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the stag instead of an animal aspect.
At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the spell aspect of the wolf rather than an animal aspect.
At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.
This replaces wild shape.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 6th level, the drovier's communal aspect ability grants the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} greater animal aspect.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 8th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} aspect of the falcon instead of an animal aspect.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 10th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} aspect of the bear instead of an animal aspect.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 12th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} aspect of the stag instead of an animal aspect.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 14th level, the drovier can choose to grant her allies the benefits of the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} aspect of the wolf rather than an animal aspect.

features.name: Communal Aspect
features.desc: At 20th level, the drovier can use this ability at will.

features.name: Claws
features.desc: At 1st level, elemental rampager gains a claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for medium creature). At 9th level damage of his claw increases to 1d8, and to 1d10 at 15th level.

features.name: Rampage
features.desc:
A druid can call upon nature's {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}strength{/g}, granting her additional combat prowess. At 1st level, a druid can rampage for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} per day equal to 4 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} modifier. For each level after 1st she possesses, the druid can rampage for 2 additional rounds per day.
While rampaging, a druid gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g}. In addition, she takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}Armor Class{/g}. These bonuses are increased by 1 at 6th level and every 5 levels after.

features.name: Elemental Rampage
features.desc: At 4th level, elemental rampager selects one element. He gains a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} with {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} while rampaging, {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} to the chosen element and other bonuses, depending on the selected element.

features.name: Claws
features.desc: At 1st level, elemental rampager gains a claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for medium creature). At 9th level damage of his claw increases to 1d8, and to 1d10 at 15th level.

features.name: Claws
features.desc: At 1st level, elemental rampager gains a claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}, that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (for medium creature). At 9th level damage of his claw increases to 1d8, and to 1d10 at 15th level.

features.name: Animal Companion
features.desc: Unlike normal animals of its kind, an animal companion's {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}Hit Dice{/g}, abilities, {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}, and {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} advance as the druid advances in level. If a character receives an animal companion from more than one source, her effective druid levels stack for the purposes of determining the statistics and abilities of the companion. Most animal companions increase in {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} when their druid reaches 4th or 7th level, depending on the companion.

features.name: Primal Size
features.desc:
A primal druid adds enlarge person to her list of class {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
She can also channel stored spell energy to cast this spell without preparing it—she can lose a prepared spell of 1st level or higher to cast enlarge person.
At 8th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he gains +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} instead of the usual bonuses.
At 16th level, if a primal druid casts enlarge person on himself, he increases by two size categories and gains +6 size bonus to Strength and Constitution instead of the usual bonuses.
